page.title: 12Religion in Crowthorne.
page.content: In 1866{"Cottage Lectures"}were held in the first Anglican place of worship in the village which was a{hay loft above a bakery.Two years later a {Temporary Church}was "opened"in the High Street.It was never consecrated, which was just as well, because when it was no longer needed it was wheeled across the road and became a shop. To-day Crowthorne is served by {Anglican, Roman Catholic, Baptist and {Methodist churches and the Broadmoor {Hospital Anglican Chapel}- all except the first two are in this sector. We found that church{attendances are rising, except at the Hospital because there are fewer patients now.The churches combine for services in{Christian Aid Week, Week of Prayer {for Christian Unity, and the annual {United Service at the Hospital.
